intro: Zaluzianskya flanaganii, commonly known as Flanagan's zonal flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This species is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and extreme temperatures. The plant is often grown as an ornamental due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
